column4: have any of you had issues with Dual booting with Linux Mint??
I tried a dual boot with Windows 7 and Linux Mint, and it was not having it
what's your real question?
tryin the linux mint channel.
My question is valid, as I want to dual boot Ubuntu with another OS
Okay, so I still don't see any question or data to help us help you. :)
What error was it?
Maybe tell if it was a Wubi install?
What is a Wubi install?
When you install from inside windows.
Did you install Ubuntu by booting off the cd, or from inside windows?
No, I made a live CD, then booted off the CD
Okay, so the way to fix it is in umm, one sec. I'm in terminal only, takes me a bit longer to google...
It can happen any time when grub gets borked for any number of reasons.
Thank you.
you can boot into the livecd and reinstall grub with a set of commands, I usually can give right away, but I'm dealing with a lot of silly here. :)
I appreciate your help.  I dont have the problem at the moment; I was merely trying to enhance my understanding, should I run into it again.  I don't want to have to wipe the drive again!
you won't have to wipe it at all, I believe it was sudo grub-install /dev/{device} iirc
Oh, sorry about the network adapter fail. Sad day. We're here if you need help. :)
The grub problem shouldn't happen right away.
Well, my main hint would be to backup anything you don't want to lose.
Yes, of course
